> APIs


* [InnerHashField](#innerhashfield) - Inner hash field counter service.


	* [Increase (/counter/inner/hash_field/{product}/{type}/{relate_id}/{field})](#increase) - Increase hash field value.


	* [Get (/counter/inner/hash_field/{product}/{type}/{relate_id}/{field})](#get) - Get hash field counter value.


	* [Set (/counter/inner/hash_field/{product}/{type}/{relate_id}/{field})](#set) - Set hash field counter value.





<h2 id="innerhashfield">InnerHashField</h2>

>  Inner hash field counter service.



<h3 id="increase">Increase</h3>

>  Increase hash field value.



* HTTP Gateway

	* URL: `/counter/inner/hash_field/{product}/{type}/{relate_id}/{field}`
	* Method: `PUT`
	* Content-Type: `application/json`

* Request Type: ***HashFieldKey***

>  Hash field key.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|product|string|string| Counter product|-|true|
|type|string|string| Counter type|-|true|
|relate_id|string|string| Counter relate ID|-|true|
|field|string|string| Counter relate ID field|-|true|
|value|int64|string| Counter value|-|false|




> JSON Demo

```json
{
  "product": "string",
  "type": "string",
  "relate_id": "string",
  "field": "string",
  "value": "string($int64)"
}
```



* Response Type: ***HashFieldKey***

>  Hash field key.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|product|string|string| Counter product|-|true|
|type|string|string| Counter type|-|true|
|relate_id|string|string| Counter relate ID|-|true|
|field|string|string| Counter relate ID field|-|true|
|value|int64|string| Counter value|-|false|

* Response Type: ***Empty***

>  A generic empty message that you can re-use to avoid defining duplicated
>  empty messages in your APIs. A typical example is to use it as the request
>  or the response type of an API method. For instance:
> 
>      service Foo {
>        rpc Bar(google.protobuf.Empty) returns (google.protobuf.Empty);
>      }
> 
>  The JSON representation for `Empty` is empty JSON object `{}`.
